intro: Giliastrum rigidulum, commonly known as the rigidstem gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds. Giliastrum rigidulum is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
